title: [Splash Arts] Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
body:
Just because a champ is not hot, cute, sexy and/or beautiful in their splash art, doesn't make it bad.
I've seen complaints about Janna, Ahri, now Katarina's splash being bad just because they aren't a superhot bombshell.

Being a designer is more than just making a hot male or female champ splash art.

Anyway, thats my 2 cents. Carry on! :)

{{champion:92}} looks perfectly fine,dunno whats your problem,but the face of a trained soldier who barely survived the massacre of her unit probably doesn't look cute enough for you

Also, Gragas should now drink Orange juice, since in some countries, alcohol is even worse than cigarettes. It makes no sense, and there's no real reason to support Riot on that desision.

So what you see as unattractive might be attractive to someone else, why is your view more right?

I know I'm going to be down voted to hell for this...

I think it's obvious that physical attractiveness is way more objective than subjective. What we all are attracted to is a product of our biology as homo sapien *animals* plus the influences of the culture we live in. Cultural differences are becoming even more minimal with the global, internet-connected world we have today. Persnal taste is like a dash of salt in comparison. 

Youth, symmetry, averageness, sexual dimorphism, indicators of health, fitness and strong genes, cleanliness - being attracted to these features are all inbedded in us period. After all these are taken into account then you can add the tiny personal preferences. Bob may prefer Jessica's Alba's tan while Joe likes Scarlet Johansson's blue eyes. In the grand scheme of things though? They're minor differences.

With all of that said- I will admit there probably is someone somewhere who prefers angular faces and masculine features in women (who works at Riot ahem). There are also people who prefer children, the elderly, and/or the disabled too. Beauty is certainly in the eye of the beholder in these cases. The other 99.999...% of cases are more...typical.
People have opinions. You can't change that unless you have extremely good debating and advertising skills. I personally like the splash coz it shows how fierce she is and is ready to strike.
